intro: Hieracium angustatum subsp. lecithodes, commonly known as the narrowleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant features narrow, elongated leaves and produces yellow flowers in clustered inflorescences. It is characterized by its robust root system and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. Botanically, it is distinguished by its subsp. lecithodes by specific leaf morphology and floral characteristics.
